stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Course 11’s Bowser-office area: elevator logic, dialogue system and Wiggler NPC supervising a construction-site strike.  He also demos a visual/performance overhaul of the “cloud ocean” stage, shows a new options menu, reviews Zeina’s Wiggler/Bowser animations, premiers a new Bowser-2 song from Badub, and outlines the next Wild-West level.

development_findings.summary: Game completion pegged at roughly 75 % during this stream.
Bowser’s office sub-area now has: reception counter with Shy Guy, functioning elevator with doors that open/close on proximity and move the player up, and contextual camera work.
development_findings.quote: Alright, let me show you what we've been working on. … this will be the elevator. There will be a door here that opens and closes when you come by and it will carry you upwards.

development_findings.summary: Dynamic strike mission scripting: Wiggler NPC delivers different hint texts depending on which of four sabotage tasks the player still needs to perform; text is removed as tasks are completed.
development_findings.quote: Whenever you destroy something, the dialogue is no longer available, so it gives you a hint as to what to do next.

development_findings.summary: Cloud-ocean level re-authored: slower cloud scroll, removed side mountains, added sky gradient and distant mobiles; looks larger and gains ~25 % frame-rate.
development_findings.quote: In the old one the whole cloud ocean was moving a lot faster… now it looks near infinite … this increases frame rate by like 25 %.

development_findings.summary: New Options menu added (interlacing toggle, Quick 64, FPS limiter); interlacing OFF boosts speed but looks worse.
development_findings.quote: Do not turn interlacing off … But this increases frame rate by like 25 %.

development_findings.summary: Next full course planned: ‘Wild West Valley’ with cowboy enemies, wanted posters, scavenger-hunt map, Dry Bones sheriff boss, red-coin star and 8-bit pipe.
development_findings.quote: The next level that I wanna do… The Wild West Valley. There’s gonna be cowboys… Drybones sheriff… a scavenger hunt.

development_findings.summary: Zeina’s Wiggler model and multi-stage animations (idle, angry, stomp-off) integrated; cylinder hit-boxes chosen over dynamic collision for performance.
development_findings.quote: This one was a lot harder to work with … What if he's just two cylinders like this? Let's do it.

development_findings.summary: Badub delivered adaptive Bowser-2 track: two channels can be muted for indoor ambience, extra channel for outdoor.
development_findings.quote: This one is composed in a specific way where you can disable two channels and you get an indoors version and you can enable another channel to get an outdoors version.

development_findings.summary: Camera improvement todo: add sphere collision or fixed camera inside elevator shaft to avoid wall clipping.
development_findings.quote: The camera should have sphere collision so you can't see through walls. That's a planned feature.

development_findings.summary: Legal/packaging plan: sell box plus manual with QR-code download link; no physical cartridge to avoid Nintendo lawsuits.
development_findings.quote: I'm not gonna make a physical cartridge because if I do I will get sued… but I might make a box and an instruction booklet… and we can make it QR scannable.

context_findings.summary: Kaze targets September releases to reduce likelihood of Nintendo DMCA.
context_findings.quote: I like to release my games around September… least likely Nintendo's gonna take them down.

context_findings.summary: He and Zeina are house-hunting; father-in-law may co-sign to save ~$20 k in taxes; mortgage roughly equal to rent but his income too low for loan.
context_findings.quote: I actually can't get a loan right now because my income is too low… he wants to help us … save around $20,000 in taxes.

context_findings.summary: Prefers YouTube over Twitch despite missing features; ads on Twitch were intolerable.
context_findings.quote: There’s so many features from Twitch that I miss. But it's not enough to go back because I don't miss the ads.

context_findings.summary: Concern that AI may render creative skills 'futile'; believes regulation will favor large corporations.
context_findings.quote: It might end up being better than humans… Big companies will push for AI regulations… then hire people to train exclusive AIs.

context_findings.summary: YouTube Shorts experiment: pays editors $5 per short; only some recoup value; maintains large backlog through Jan next year.
context_findings.quote: I pay $5 per short… My hope is that one of these shorts just take off.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback on cloud-ocean overhaul, proposed adding child’s bedroom scenery and table for Yoshi plushes in Bowser office cut-scene.
Generated dialogue ideas for Wiggler and Wild West level; suggested hints like 'One of my guys has been on lunch break.'
biobak.quote: One of my guys has been on a lunch break for a while, mind checking on him.

badub.summary: Delivered new adaptive music for Bowser’s second level; designed with channel muting for indoor/outdoor feel.

zeina.summary: Created full Wiggler animation set (idle, angry, stomp, talk) and new Bowser chair/stomp animations.
zeina.quote: Yes, I made this angry face… Wiggler’s animation was a lot harder than Bowser's walk cycle but I did it faster.

key_stories.title: Building Bowser’s Office & Elevator
key_stories.summary: Kaze wires up a fully functioning office lobby inside Course 11, complete with receptionist, elevator doors and strike-breaker narrative. Multiple bugs (doors not moving, Y-offset drift) are tracked and fixed live.
key_stories.challenge: Enable an in-game elevator that feels diegetic and bug-free.
key_stories.process: Iteratively scripts door proximity triggers, motion logic, sound cues, and camera, debugging object-home and gravity interactions.
key_stories.outcome: Elevator now opens, lifts Mario, and closes correctly; sets stage for Bowser office cut-scene.
key_stories.key_quote: Hey, we got an elevator shaft!

key_stories.title: Cloud Ocean Visual Rebuild
key_stories.summary: The earlier version looked cramped and ran poorly. Kaze slows cloud scroll, removes side mountains, adds gradient sky and re-positions mobiles.
key_stories.challenge: Level felt small and cost performance.
key_stories.process: Graphics tweaks in Blender/Fast64, performance tests, Biobak feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Stage appears vast and gains ~25 % FPS.
key_stories.key_quote: Now it looks near infinite and the mountains on the sides I removed…

key_stories.title: Wiggler Overseer & Dynamic Strike Dialogue
key_stories.summary: Zeina delivers new Wiggler model; Kaze scripts it as site foreman whose dialogue changes as Mario sabotages construction tasks, guiding player while advancing story.
key_stories.challenge: Make an NPC that both characterizes labor unrest mission and provides adaptive hints.
key_stories.process: Design four sabotage tasks, write four corresponding dialogue sets, tie availability to mission flags, integrate hit-boxes and animations.
key_stories.outcome: Wiggler now cycles through context-sensitive lines and becomes non-interactive after final task.
key_stories.key_quote: Whenever you destroy something, the dialogue is no longer available, so it gives you a hint as to what to do next.
